flow.descriptionCdata:
f838e581-3a6b-448e-9679-f7bb110e1abd.2a16b58c-97bd-4f7b-9027-b300eae1bb36.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
f838e581-3a6b-448e-9679-f7bb110e1abd.596a13ba-0664-432b-9a7f-812ddd302e2e.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
f838e581-3a6b-448e-9679-f7bb110e1abd.6dc33100-4b10-4b75-bef2-22baf9c79932.description=Generic flow to send an e-mail f838e581-3a6b-448e-9679-f7bb110e1abd.7d270dbd-9218-4dbe-9e6e-59f2d3bff86a.description=
The operation invokes web service methods.  This operation should not be used directly\!  Please use the wizard to build flows that use this operation.

Inputs\:
    xmlTemplate - The template of the soap request to make.
    inputMap - A map used to map between template names and user-friendly names. The template names are pipe-delimited xpaths of the xmltemplate location, with a numerical element for lists.
Value format\: A list of elements separated by the new line delimiter. Eache element hes the format\: \=.
Example\: A line in the "inputMap" could be\: "Request|Details|0|Input|x\=input0.x"
    url - The url to Post to. 
    header_SOAPAction - The SOAPAction http header field, defined by many web services for indicating the intent of the request
    wswAuthenticationType - The authentication type to use for the "username" and "password" input.
Default value\: http
Valid values\: http, ntlm, ws-security digest, ws-security text
    WSSecuritySignRequest - Should the SOAP request be signed using WS-Security.
Default value\: false
Valid values true, false
    WSSecurityEncryptRequest - Should the entire SOAP request be signed using WS-Security.
Default value\: false
Valid values true, false
    WSSecurityTimestampRequest - Should the Timestamp attribute be added to the WS-Security header
Default value\: false
Valid values true, false
    WSSecurityKeystore - Keystore to use for encrypting and signing requests.
    WSSecurityKeystoreType - The type of "WSSecurityKeystore".
    WSSecurityKeystorePassword - The password for "WSSecurityKeystore".
    contentType - Value to be used in the Content-Type HTTP header.
Default value\: text/xml
    characterSet - The character set for HTTP Get request and response.
Default value\: UTF-8
    username - The username to use for authenticating with the web service.
Value format\: For NTLM authentication, the required format is domain\user.
    password - The password to use for authenticating with the web service.
    trustAllRoots - Enables weak security over SSL. A SSH certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it.
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false
    useCookies - Enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls.
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false
    usesJSON - Use JSON arrays for the SOAP Request for all Array types.
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false
    timeout - a timeout after which the connection should be terminated or 0 for no timeout.
    socketTimeout - The time to wait for data to be retrieved, in milliseconds. This input needs a value greater than or equal to zero. A "socketTimeout" value of '0' represents an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0
    proxy - A proxy to use when accessing the web service.
    proxyPort - A port on the proxy to connect to.
    proxyUsername - A username to use when connecting to the proxy.
    proxyPassword - A password to use when connecting to the proxy.
    keystore - The path to the keystore to use for SSL Client Certificates when using http authentication.
    keystorePassword - The password for the keystore when using http authentication.
    ICONCLUDE_WSW_VERSION - This value is used internally by the operation.
    returnXMLRequest - If this input is set to true, a new output named "rawXMLRequest" is returned from the operation which contains the text of the SOAP request that will be sent. This can be very valuable in troubleshooting.
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false

Results\:
    returnCode - This is the primary output. It contains the value 0 if the operation successfully completes and the value -1 otherwise.
    document - Raw XML response.
    documentStripped - Raw XML response stripped of namespaces for ease in parsing with XML XPath operations.
    jsonStripped - Raw XML response stripped of namespaces for ease in parsing with JSON operations, input usesJSON must be set to true for this to be populated.

Responses\:
    success - SOAP request completed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong.

Notes\:
1.If wswAuthenticationType\=ws-security text then this operation transmits passwords in clear-text.
2.Any additional inputs that follow these are added by the Web Service Wizard, and they are specific to the particular web service method being called.
3.If you add new step-level inputs with the name header_, where  is the name of an html header, then that html header will be set to the given value in the HTTP request.
4.This operation will not allow connection through secure transport layers below TLS 1.0.
f838e581-3a6b-448e-9679-f7bb110e1abd.976db300-c44f-4418-b41e-54f204a68f04.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
f838e581-3a6b-448e-9679-f7bb110e1abd.c5113ed5-351b-46ee-aecf-05caabed2844.callout=Call API to update data status in ESL. This sub flow is used by post_undeploy process f838e581-3a6b-448e-9679-f7bb110e1abd.d5733c32-088a-4434-b2c5-505d9a2b32b7.callout=check ESL response message to determine if succeed f838e581-3a6b-448e-9679-f7bb110e1abd.f3676c38-075c-46dd-9660-35dd637f7c17.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
    string1 - The first string. 
Default value\: "" (empty)
    string2 - The second string.
Default value\: "" (empty)
    ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

Responses\:
    true - If the two strings are equal.
    false - If the two strings are not equal.
f838e581-3a6b-448e-9679-f7bb110e1abd.f480ac40-5075-4917-a5db-ccc19b4cdea3.description=
This operation loops as many times as specified in the "count" input, counting from "1" to a greater number, incrementing it by "1" at each iteration.

Inputs\:
    count - The number of loops to complete.
Valid values\: from 1 to 9223372036854775807
    reset - Specifies whether the counter restarts counting from "1".
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    to - The number to count to. It will take the value of the "count" input field. 
    from - The number to start counting at. For this operation, it is customized to "1".
    incrementBy - The number to increment by while counting. For this operation, it is customized to "1".

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the value of the number that was just counted.

Responses\:
    has more – The counting process is not complete. One or more iterations are pending.
    no more – The counting process is complete.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
1. It is recommended that you do not change the values of the "to", "from" or "incrementBy" input fields.
2. The "from", "to" and "incrementBy" inputs are customized for this operation. Even though you can also customize them, if you need to specify the loop range borders and the increment value, use the "Counter" operation.

Examples\:
1. For a loop with 20 iterations, the following values should be provided for the input fields\:
    count\: 20
    reset\: false (this field can also be left blank, as "false" is the default value)
2. For an infinite loop, the value of "count" should be at least "1" and the value of "reset" should be "true".
flow.name: ESL_UpdateCIStatus

step.name: Call ESL API to Update CI
